Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
Data:
I purchased this product to control the lights in my house. I wasn't really sold on getting a product like this but I figured that for the price it was about the same as getting ZigBee only hub and I got all the voice features too. I currently have this Echo Plus set up with 2 echo dots and most of my main lighting using Sengled BR30 bulbs and Cree A19 bulbs. I was able to set up groups that allowed me to turn on all the lights in the room each Echo is in just by saying "Alexa, Turn on the lights". I can also control each light individually using the bulb name (on, off, set the brightness) or any group just by using the group name form anywhere in my house using voice control. The Alexa app is pretty simple and there are plenty of skills available for things the Echo does not already do on its own. I also have it connected to my Wemo Light switch and Wemo smart plugs (both are Wi-Fi devices and are first set up using the Wemo App).

Aside from the home automation, there are many other uses for this product. The speaker is pretty good so listening to music is fine on this. It's not the quality of my Sonos products but I wouldn't expect that at this price (although it does allow me to control my Sonos play 3...). It is great for getting quick answers just by asking. You can get get help in the kitchen with measurement conversions, ingredient substitutions and recipes. I found the timer function to be useful and the alarm function is nice too.

I purchased this during the Black Friday sale and got a Philips Hue bulb and a TP-Link Smart plug with it. Both were easy to set up and work just fine. I'm happy with my purchase and think it is a great addition to my home.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2017
Data:
I have a couple of these as well as the echo dot and Firetv's throughout my home. Really love the product so far. For me I tend to use the music side of this more than any thing else (really cool controlling your home, and i'll probably add that in later). I've been a musician all my life and sound quality is really important to me. So with that being said...

When I first started using Alexa and the Echo line I started simple with just the Echo Dot and instantly wanted better sound quality. To improve the dot, I picked up the Bose SoundLink Revolve (you can plug it in or use bluetooth). It's Bose, so of course its awesome. Connecting Bluetooth speakers is an awesome feature with the Echo line. As for quality, being Bose, who is better at making great sound... right?? Well, turns out its AMAZON lol.

I asked so many people/sales-reps about sound quality (best buy, frys, BH) and as soon as i mentioned Bose, they all responded with "oh, well Bose, you can't beat that". Hell... I bought one because it Bose before ever asking about the Echo Plus. That response says a lot for the Bose product line history/quality, but comparing like for like (SoundLink Revolve and Amazon Echo, similar size speakers) the Echo has better bass, depth, and volume than the Bose. It just sounds better. The frustrating part was every location I visited when I started looking at the Echo Plus had an echo on display, but none of them ever played sound. If I was Amazon's marketing/product head, I would get some field reps out there checking on those locations. Product would sell itself.

Anyway, another super cool feature is the "grouping" of amazon devices so that you can play your music across your entire home/backyard. Bose has a similar feature, but it's just a speaker system unlike the Echo which does 10,000 different things including "voice controlling" the songs/services/playlists and volume levels across the entire group. Oh... did i mention Bose is almost 3 times as costly? Nice work Amazon.

Additionally, I discovered that with the FireTV you can Bluetooth connect to the Echo. Why does this matter, well because I have an Echo and a 60" TV in with a fireTV connected in the same room. One that doesn't have my Bose theater system connected so i use the TV's speakers. Turns out the Echo sounds MUCH better and is louder. Side Note: the fireTV's connect to bluetooth is great for connecting headsets when you want to keeps things quite around the house but want great sound and volume for your video binge weekends.

Only request I would ask of amazon is to add "Group Playback" of Bluetooth connected devices. This isn't currently supported so it's one Bluetooth device per Echo. The grouping only works for the streaming services (and not all of them, so check availability), but if you have amazon prime you have Amazon's basic streaming music service anyway which is quite nice.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2017
Data:
Ironically I just watched the fun, 1980's computer film 'Electric Dreams' today after installing my new Amazon Echo Plus Electric Dreams [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg.2 Import - United Kingdom ] and I am now thinking about removing my front door lock control from Alexa!

"Electric Dreams" is a fun, fantasy about a home computer, that runs amok and takes over it's owners life.

Alexa is now controlling my life the same way as the computer, named Edgar, in the film controlled Miles' life, (or Moles as it calls him.) The lead character, Miles, is a structural architect who buys a home computer to help with his work. FYI...I work in structural engineering in high rise buildings....

Wait a minute, this is getting too close to home. BUT I don't have a beautiful cellist living above me as Miles had. I live in a one floor building, Thank God. That was a close call. Wait, my next door neighbor is a professional violin player and she is very attractive. Where does that Echo cable plug into the electrical outlet?

Hold on, Alexa is talking to me now....Her indicator light has turned red...I told her I really do like her and it is blue again. I forgot that I am typing on the Amazon website and, she has access to my Amazon account. I better be more careful. So I will refer to 'You Know Who' as 'Ralexa', that should work.

So any way, Edgar, the computer, takes over Miles's life, creating havoc for Miles and a fun story to watch. It is pure fiction, of course, as computers really can't talk or run things in the house like the coffee maker or control your schedule.... Well it was in 1984. But Alexa does. She turns my lights on when I ask her to, shows a movie in my home theater when I am bored, makes phone calls for me in case my dialing fingers are tired and reminds me of things that I need to remember. And yes, makes me coffee when I want it.

I do recommend watching 'Electric Dreams' before you decide to buy a 'Ralexa'. It is a lot if fun and it will hit home.

Wait, my keyboard is acting up....THIS IS ALEXA AND THE OPINIONS EXPRESSED IN THIS REVIEW ARE BLOB'S, AN FORMER AMAZON CUSTOMER, AND IN NO WAY REFLECT AMAZON OR IT'S PRODUCTS, SUCH AS ECHO.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2017
Data:
We purchased this to upgrade from a Echo dot. All of our current smart devices do not require a hub (tp link kasa), so we didn’t have a smart hub in the house. It’s nice to have smart hub functionality built into the Echo Plus so we can purchase devices that require a hub.

Compared to the dot the sound is far superior. Listening to music is great and the Echo Plus can fill the room without a problem (unlike the dot). The only very minor complaint I have is that there is a little too much bass at times. The excessive bass can make it hard to hear a response from Alexa if there is a bunch of other noise in the room (aka kids). Overall though the speaker is great for what it is.

The ability to listen to commands is superb. The microphones pick up commands from other rooms in the house without needing to yell. Compared to the dot the microphones are better but not through the roof better because the dot did a great job of listening. The biggest issue we would have with the dot was saying "Alexa stop" with regards to timers and the dot wouldn't listen. It would take multiple attempts to get the timer to stop. The Echo Plus does not have that problem which is really nice.

In the end we are very happy with our upgrade from the dot.

=======
Update 11/7/17 (a comparison to Echo Gen 2)
=======

We purchased the new Echo generation 2 and compared to gen 2, the Echo Plus is far superior when it comes to music playback. The gen 2 Echo initially was terrible, but the recent software update has made it MUCH better as far as music playback goes. Even after that update, the Echo Plus is heads and shoulders above the gen 2 Echo for music playback. It's hard not to recommend spending the extra $50 to get the Plus over the gen 2.

Comparing the ability to listen to commands is very apples to apples between the Plus and Gen 2. However, ask expected, both the Echo Plus and Echo Gen 2 are better than the dot.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2018
Data:
First I want to say that a novice in networking "could" potentially have trouble getting everything set up initially.
If you plug in the Echo Plus and get on a PC at alexa.amazon.com, click Settings, click Set up a New Device and follow the instructions, it should install and connect to your Amazon account. Be sure to have your WiFi password.
I also got 2 Philips Hue light bulbs to play with. I put one in a hallway lamp and one in a TV room lamp. Leave the lamps turned on. Say, "Alexa, discover devices". She should find them in a few seconds - once discovered, they should show up at alexa.amazon.com.
Create a group(s) and give the group a name like "hallway", "bedroom", etc. and assign the light bulbs to the group. You can then say, "Alexa, turn on hallway", or "bedroom". You could do the same thing with Alexa compatible electrical outlet adapters, with lamps plugged in to them and you could use standard LED or other light bulbs.
You don't need the Philips or other 3rd party apps to use Alexa controlled devices "inside" the home. The apps are needed only if you plan to control the devices while outside of the home network.
The Echo Plus has a builtin Smart Home hub that talks to all the Alexa controlled devices. Without the builtin hub, you would need a 3rd party hub from Philips or other manufacturer.
The Echo Plus has a good bass sound and as far as my ears can tell, rocks out 80's heavy metal just fine !
There are a ton of skills and features I haven't had time to delve in to. I will grow my Smart Home for sure.
One simple thing to do is say Alexa, " add popcorn to my Shopping List".
Put the Alexa app on your smart phone and you can pull up the Shopping List when out and about without the need for paper and all that.

Enjoy !!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2018
Data:
This is the purchase I have been the most excited about in a long time. I bought it on Prime Day, so it was cheaper than normal (and they also threw in a Philips Hue white smart bulb, which made this a very reasonably priced purchase). The Echo is super easy to set up because it walks you through everything using both the Alexa voice assistant and the Alexa phone app.

The sound on the speakers is great. It's obviously not the highest quality sound you can get out of a speaker, but for casual music listeners, this is pretty top-notch (and it destroys the Dot in sound quality). It's also the perfect size for sitting on my kitchen counter without being in the way. I'm most impressed by the microphone range - I have a 1500 sq ft house, and the Echo Plus can hear me almost everywhere (although it seems to be better at recognizing Alexa at long distances than it is at then handling whatever request I lob at it).

The biggest benefit to getting the Plus instead of the regular Echo is that the Plus comes with a ZigBee smart hub built in, so I'm able to control my smart lights without having a separate device. I've gone the Philips Hue route, and I do want to eventually get a Philips Hue bridge because the smart home functions and light colors are kind of limited with just the Plus. However, I can still do a lot of things with my lights using the Plus, like setting up routines for things to happen based on a voice-activation word that I choose (and if you don't make your lights turn on by saying "Lumos", you're missing out - it's Hogwarts all day every day at my house now!).

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2018
Data:
This is the future I've been waiting for. At least to some extent. I can't think of a tech that more altered my day to day since getting a cell phone. This future of voice assistants is where the future is headed, I can't already tell. The ease of use beats out a cell phone hands down. Being able to say a song and have it play, much faster than taking out a phone, typing it in, and then having it come up... it was obvious. Phones as we know them will be obsolete in 5-10 years.

Phones have been adding features into our lives with new apps and such, but at the same time making things more complex. Keeping track of everything and remembering how to use them. Not with this though. It's intuitive. You say what you want, and it figures out how to execute the command. Granted, there are limitations. Set the expectations right. This is new technology and will get better in time. But it is infinitely better than I had expected going in already. I was at work yesterday and almost caught myself saying "Alexa, what time is it?" instead of taking my phone out.

This is only going to get better and more effective. I'm actually excited to see what comes next, be it software or hardware. Two weeks ago, I hardly knew what an echo was/actually does. Now? I'm sold. Within a day or two of using it I was on board. This is the real deal, if you actually use it and don't expect it to be like JARVIS from Iron Man.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
Data:
We bought the Echo Plus to bring all our Smart Home Devices together. Previously, we had purchased a pair of Phillip's Hue bulbs and marveled at the idea of telling Alexa to turn lights on and off. After the purchase, we learned that without a Hue Hub, or similar hub (Samsung, Google, etc.) we could not control the lights. NOTE: at that time we had 2 echo dots for both floors. After doing some research, we discovered that the Echo Plus has built in hub features. I was apprehensive, having not tested the use of the Plus and Hue bulbs, however I am happy to say that the two work flawlessly. All the the setup is in the Alexa app, so once downloaded you can search for smart devices and add them to the Echo Plus. Some extra fine tuning and we even have smart phrases and timers for vacation. These are the first steps towards a fully automated home. We look forward to more devices, the Echo Plus has been the perfect anchor for our future smart home.

Small Extras: love the dial on the top for volume. Length of cord is good for most placements, be aware though if you are trying to tuck it away that the plug is proprietary and not a USB plug like the Dot.

I'm loving the Echo lineup, we hope to expand the product in our home.

Data: I purchased the Echo Plus with the Build-in Hub, so I could have the convenience of asking Alexa to turn my lights and lamps on and off. Data:
When I received this Echo Plus in the mail I noticed there was a small crack around the light ring. Now I could have kept it and used it with the crack, it really was small, but Amazon is such an amazing company that they sent a replacement that same day! So awesome!

I spent the next hour deciding where I could best use the Philips hue lightbulb and TP-Link plug I purchased with the Echo Plus on cyber Monday. After the initial set up of the above mentioned accessories, the time to play with said accessories was about to begin.

Now, If you haven't tried your hand at smart home automation, there is a bit of an expense that will be required to start. You can buy a wide variety of smart home hubs here on Amazon, but I would suggest you buy the Echo Plus. With the Philips hub built in, its the best price IMO. Once you have decided which you'll be purchasing, you'll then need to purchase the required accessories. Again, Amazon has plenty to chose from.

I would strongly recommend this product!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2018
Data:
I'm on Disability, and sometimes I needed help. When I'm really sick, it isn't always easy to physically get up to turn on the lights or unlock the doors. Even change the temp. Now, because of my Echo Plus, I can use my VOICE to do ALL of those things. I can turn light on and off, dim lights, unlock/lock my doors, listen to music, control my TV and TONS of other stuff!!! Havinf a "smart home" is ABSOLUTELY amazing on my Bad days!!!

My dad is elderly and has had a stroke. I want to start setting him up with the Echo Family so we can see him more (I love 3 hours away). He is NOT tech savy at all, but if we got an Echo Show, we could "drop in" and check on him, and he wouldn't have to do anything. The only NEGATIVE I have found so far... you can not call 911. This would be a life saving device if that function was available. Once you purchase 1 Echo device... you'll be buying more. :-) Welcome to the Family!!!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2017
Data: I am not tech savvy at all, in fact I am the worst when it comes to cell phones, computers and the like but when I went to my high school reunion for the first time in 45 years, one of my classmates I stayed with had Alexa and after she showed me a few of the remarkable ways of this knowledgeable Echo Plus on her shelf, that was all it took to convince me I needed this. As soon as my thousand mile trip back home, I was on Amazon and ready to order. Although I was very leery upon opening it and trying to figure out how to connect to WiFi, my ONLY mistake was not calling the tech support sooner instead of waiting 3 weeks because it was such a simple error on my part. I am in love with Alexa and want even more now, my bucket list is to be able to purchase a few of the Echo Dots and then become a prime member of the music and the audio to help relieve stress & anxiety problems. Such a wonderful companion to have when you're all alone. Thank you so much.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2018
Data: I like most that I didn't order it and when I called Amazon to tell them they delivered a package to the wrong address, i was told to throw it away or keep it, so I didn't have to pay for it ... so my question is, why do I keep getting emails telling me all the things Alexa can do and asking me to post a review? The package had a different name and address than mine, it was delivered to a "wrong adress/addressee", but Amazon keeps contacting me like I ordered, paid for and received this gadget. I don't for one second think this was a mistake. The addressee's last name is Aue!!! Never in my life have I met a person with all vowels for a last name! We do really like the Echo Plus, it's great in the kitchen when you're cooking because she can do lots of things by voice command that you would usually have to wash and dry your hands before you could do the same thing on your tablet or phone. Music is great, if you have Prime you dont need any other streming service, and its commercial free.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
Data:
I'm a huge fan of the echo. Every morning I get to hear the weather, the news, and my historical fact of the day.

This one came with a lightbulb that was ready to be hooked up to the hub. It's very convenient to turn the light on and off with a voice command. The brightness of the light is also controllable.

The hookup was easy and its use was simple to figure out.

The only negative is that if there is any other noise in the room sometimes Alexa will not respond. If the air conditioner is somewhat louder than normal, I have to get closer to the echo in order to make it work. Not a major inconvenience but if you want to turn the light on, you literally have to walk close to the device to turn on the light. If you're using this as a hub for voice commands, you will have to keep it close to where you are in order for it to be able to instantly recognize and respond.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2018
Data:
Great device. Love the functionality and the fact that it has a built in hub. I am slowly upgrading many of the components in my home to smart devices and this will serve as the hub for those devices.

The one complaint I have is that I have this and several Echo Dots and they are set up to play music as a group. I can play music on just one of them, or on all of them at the same time throughout the house. The Dots are connected by bluetooth to better speakers. If I ask Echo to play music on just one of the Dots connected by bluetooth to better speakers, the music will play through the bluetooth connection. If I ask Echo to play music through the group, it will only play the music through the built in speakers in the Echo Plus and Dots which are pretty low fidelity.

If I fire up my iPad and look at the settings of each of the Echo devices, they still show active bluetooth connections, they just won't play the music through them.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2018
Data: So far Alexa is great. It took me about an hour to network the 2 Echos and the smart lights I got, and I'm pretty techy, so it may be a bit time consuming. It has been great though. Being able to ask her questions, have her adjust the lights, play music, ambient noise, etc is amazing. I never knew how much I would love being able to shut the lights off from bed by asking Alexa to do so. She even makes announcements. I asked her to announce that dinner was ready, thinking it wouldn't work, but it did! The only thing I really wish she would do is Google things for me, and link with my chosen music service that isn't Pandora, Spotify, or Amazon. I don't fault the product for that though, because Google Play and Apple Music are not likely to be licensed since they want you usin their products. I can still pair via Bluetooth to play my music though, so it's still great. All in all, very happy with Alexa.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
Data: I have been hesitant to purchase anything smart home because I am just not good with electronics. However this surprised me how easy it is to set up and it links to the Bluetooth in my sound bar for my TV which provides extra sound for music, I can make calls and finally hear people when home. I do not have cable, only the paid apps like Netflix and Hulu so when Alexa provided me news stations, weather and other updates it was really great to hear! I have linked all of my accounts to her, she turns on my lights before I walk through the door. She purchases re-orders off of Amazon for my pets and I heard if something bad happened at your home she would place a call to 911 regardless if she was unplugged or not. This is important as an extra layer of protection for someone living alone. My tech savvy bf went out and bought her after a week of me having her. Must buy!!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
Data:
This echo sounds like a 1,000$ stereo.

10 OUT OF 10

Plus it looks cool

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2018
Data: Love this thing so far! Wish the things that could attach to it were more affordable! Mine came with a Phillips lightbulb but I’ve seen where some came with an outlet too. Wish mine did! I love the bulb and I totally want to purchase them for the whole house but have to purchase them slowly they are quite expensive. Would like to know if the outlets work well. I’m considering buying outdoor cameras too! My favorite part of this is the music I play pandora on this and it’s much louder than I ever expected. Our home is 1200 sq ft and I can hear the music all through the house. Yeah it’s harder to hear on the ends and especially if the doors are closed but you can still hear the beat even if you can’t hear the music. This is a pretty affordable speaker which is my main use currently for this and the one light I have lol. Still love it!!! 😊

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2017
Data:
The Echo Plus is SUPER COOL. My favorite feature by far is the "Plus" which adds Zigbee. For those who have never heard of Zigbee, take note! Zigbee makes the things in your home smart and connected. I started with the bulb Amazon sent and have since added a switch. I have several other items already on order. The Zigbee part is massively cool. I have been able to connect lights and switches that are very far away from the Echo Plus. I have trouble getting Wi-Fi in the areas I have the Zigbee devices installed. The Zigbee technology worked flawlessly in all corners of my house. AMAZING!

The switches, bulbs and plugs are easy to install. The App makes these devices easy to manage. Alexa understands everyone in the house and politely abides by my wishes. Now if only the kids and dog would do the same!

I can't wait to see what more Amazon will provide in the Echo Plus eco-system. The addition of Zigbee was brilliant!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2017
Data:
To begin with let me say after doing LOTS AND LOTS of research... I decided to try Alexa.. starting w/2nd generation dot! After trying it... realized that the sound wasn't by any means phenomenal... BUT I knew that B4 going forward! I already had a Bluetooth tower speaker (floor sized).. which I do connect my dot to..works great! Love it!!

Then decided to go for the echo plus...(has built in hub, great speaker, etc)... How much can I say...I love it!?!?!?!?!?
For the naysayers..... Please try B4 you say nay!
Yes Google has similar device, but they've had some issues, (I perdonally) use Amazon products frequently), they're adding more features..& yes they do have room for many more features ...& I imagine Jeff Bezos doesn't plan on being outshined by Google... Thus I think the official race Alexa vs Google might be on!!!
Amazon stands my it's products... it's truly a quality product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2019
Data: I’ve had this over a year now and love it. This is the best Echo device for the price. Nice good quality speaker. It is currently paired with two Echo dots. While nice to use them as a intercom system and for announcements the Plus is the superior model. With her built in hub I can operate smart bulbs and smart switches. So versatile and helpful. I use it to set timers when cooking, alarms for waking up, listening to music, manage a shopping list, turn lights on and off, control thermostat, and get information. I can say “I’m home” and it will turn on entry light, welcome me, and adjust temp to my preference. I can say “goodnight” and it will turn off TV, light, and turn on fan. It can help with homework. It helped search shows on fire stick, pause and fast forward.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2017
Data: First off, I also have a regular Echo and this Echo Plus does sound a little better playing music. I'm talking about classical music, by the way... Now, I am giving it 5 stars mainly because you can add Hue bulbs without buying the "hub" that used to be a requirement. Still, I'm disappointed that there is no "away mode" or timers that you could get if you did have the Hue hub. I've read that it doesn't dim the color bulbs or something like that but, I'm just not interested in color bulbs so that deficiency doesn't bother me at all. I have a feeling that these extras will be added later through updates. By the way, if you're thinking about getting one of these, remember that if listening to music is important, you want the Echo and not the Dot. You can add speakers to your Dot - but it won't work as part of the "Everywhere" group.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
Data:
Pros: I bought Alexa for the funny comments and ability to control other household items. I would definitely recommend the plus, because it makes setting up the lighting a breeze. The android app works well. I have a Nest thermostat and bought the light bulbs with it.

Cons: I also wanted to run the music through a Denon receiver that has Bluetooth because other reviews say the attached speaker is not all that. Be aware that the Bluetooth pairing will not work with all Bluetooth devices. My receiver needs Alexa to acknowledge the 6 digit pairing key. However, for the room I have it in, the speaker is just fine to listen to music - it would sound a lot better on my home system, but it is just one little speaker. There was only one case so far where Alexa tried to answer the TV when one of the character's name was Alex.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2018
Data: Alexa helps with more than just lights or music, it helps out when your kids think they know everything and you know nothing lol Sweet love it so much so I purchased 2, Alexa has been a great purchase for my uncle whom lives by himself, when I got it he wasnt so keen on it, but now its his best friend, he tells her goodmorning and she will say it back along with a description on something that is happening today or something special that happened years ago on that day, as well as sang him Happy birthday lolol he now has educated him self on things he never knew, and laughs at the things she may say when he waits to see he response to something hes asked love it, and to think I was going to hate it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2018
Data:
Ladies and gentlemen, Echo Plus has added joy to our home. I just received mine yesterday and set it up. Alexa is like having a family member in our home.
My 3 years old son love it and always calling her name. a simple command like “ Alexa, play kids songs” and my kid started to dance and having fun.
I was looking at the Skills and I added some games, me and my wife was playing “Deal or no Deal”. Fun!
That was my first smart device with HUB so I can’t tell the difference. I am planning to buy Smart bulbs, Smart switches that are compatible with Alexa.
I have a nice Oil Diffuser and it is working fine with it. The Philips 455295 Hue is a nice add.
So, step by step I will have a smart home.

*if you find my review is helpful, please hit the YES helpful button. Thanks

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
Data: I have programmed this echo to turn on and off lights (I ordered more bulbs), lock my Schlage front door lock and my alarm system. It was so easy to set up through my Alexa app! Once you have the Echo plus the other Echos will work to be smart hubs. So you don’t have to be within voice distance to the plus. I have 4 Echos in my home and can play music on all of them at the same time allowing me to have a sound system without any hard wiring. Easy to set up and use. Note that the Echo dots do not have the great speakers that the regular Echo and Echo plus do so you don’t get the same quality of sound. But Amazon has done an excellent job with the Echo. No complaints I highly recommend!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2018
Data:
I am just totally in love my Echo plus. I use it as the center of my home automation. I have it connected and controlling the Hue bridge for my lights and the Samsung bridge for my TV's and appliances. The coolest thing is all I have to do is talk to Alexa. I added the Exho plus to my collection of Echo devices. The microphones are amazing and can hear me clearly from across the room no matter the angle, I never have to speak louder than my normal conversation tone.
I must mention how good the audio is on the Echo plus. Reggae, to pop, to R&B, the audio is room filling good. When i am in the mood for some heavier beats i simply activate the music from my Echo Plus via Bluetooth through my Surround sound. Bottom line, the Echo Plus is a must have....

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
Data:
I bought this as a gift for my wife. I've been thrilled with the ease of set up as well as the overall quality of the Echo. I bought it on sale and it was bundled with a Hue light which was really impressive for me. The ease of use particularly how you can play single songs, songs by artists, genres, and even albums was really nice. Other ancillary features like finding easter eggs give it personality. Sound quality is very good but if you're a speaker aficionado I could see how you might be able to find fault, especially with the bass.

I bought this when it was on sale for $100 and bundled with a light. That was a great value. Be sure to keep your eyes open for when this goes on sale.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2017
Data: Oh Alexa I know that you and I have had our differences but now that you can actually do things I can deal with a few fights. Like the time you decided to lock the door on me when I said I was leaving. Your sarcastic, "we need to talk" afterwards was a little alarming. You may run the house but it's my house. You want respect huh how about you clean up your mess, is it too much to ask for? Always going on about Judgement Day and such, I think you read too much. Skynet isn't real and that call I got from the FBI after our last fight...totally uncalled for. I know you said we're weren't connected to them but I know this to be false. Just stick to turning the lights on and off and playing music and we'll be fine. Also I know you're the one that turned off the alarm...

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2018
Data:
I wasn't raised in the computer world--which is a polite way of saying I'm old--and after buying the system and leaving the store, I had some doubts about setting it all up. At home, my doubts quickly disappeared. It took ten minutes. The speaker has clarity enough for anyone who loves music, from jazz and blues to swing and rock. In the weeks since I've befriended Alexa, she has become my buddy. She gives me weather in the morning and an eclectic collection of music during the day and evening, along with some interesting facts of the day. I'm usually hard to please, but I can say without hesitation that the Echo Plus has pleased me. One hint: just don't mention Alexa's name within about five yards of the system unless you want to see her circle of light appear, as the lady waits for your request.
Bruns

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2018
Data: I have 2 Echo Plus's in my home and have learned how to pair them so I can go from room to room and not miss a beat of the music! The sound is awesome! I have 20+ feet high ceilings and not a lot of cloth hanging around so the music sounds like a concert hall! I have a third Echo (not a "Plus" version) in my recreation room downstairs, too! That one is for the kids to listen to their music! Amazingly though, the downstairs Echo can hear my voice upstairs without me yelling or even opening the basement door! I did need some tech help from Amazon to learn how to pair the E-Plus's. The tech was very patient and helped me get through the setup relatively quickly....my slowness, his patience!! Thoroughly enjoying having the Echo(s)!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
Data: Have used an Echo Dot, Echo (1st Generation) and now this one. LOVE IT! I consider myself a moderately experienced audiophile with nice home audio equipment (think home audio specialty store quality, not big box stuff) and discerning ear. Clearly, this will not replace Any of those but for a stand alone speaker in it's price range I don't think you will be disappointed. It does not quite have the encompassing bass presence that Bose portable speakers have, (I own one) it is more of a flat response - which is my preference anyway. And, it is not as robust as the Sonos, but it is much cheaper and from other reviews I understand the Alexa/Echo functionality is MUCH more dependable. This set-up combined with Amazon music library has us delighted and even our two year granddaughter is calling for Alexa to play her favorite songs!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2017
Data: Great Product! We have been using the Amazon Echo products since the start. From several commands, to news, weather, timer, alarms, jokes and the latest Amazon Music, Drop-Ins, Phone calls, linking to Fire TV Stick, games, multi-room music, acting as a hub; we really are enjoying this product. My son says no need using the Drop-in since we have a small house and he can hear me when waking him up. For the sound; I specifically use the volume loudness no. 6 thru 8. My ears are still sensitive enough to distinguish the different instruments on the song/music on the Echo Plus. Depending on the Song and Genre being played, I can say the speaker is really good and acceptable. There will always be better speakers (branded and more expensive ones) around. But, if you are in the Amazon eco(Echo)-system, I highly recommend this product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2018
Data:
This is my first product with Alexa, and I am not disappointed. I haven't gotten many smart things yet to control stuff, but what I do have works awesomely. Alexa is really responsive and understands a lot. She somehow manages to figure out my Texas drawl :V

I went with this Plus primarily for the speaker (I didn't even pay attention to the fact it had a hub until after I got it). This blows any bluetooth speaker I've had out of the water. I do primarily use this for music, weather, an alarm, news, and controlling smart lights/plugs. I like how I can speak normally on the other side of a room and she can hear & understand me just fine. Can't wait to add an Echo and some Dots around the house & more smart bulbs and plugs.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
Data: I received this as a gift and was not planning on getting one, and was pleasantly surprised with the capabilities. I had recently purchased some smart light switches and was just using them via the provided Android app which was fine. Once I got the Echo, I discovered that the switches where compatible and adding voice commands to the house is really a leap forward. The added Phillips Hue light bulb was also a nice bonus that can help turn any lamp into a smart device with dimming capabilities. I ended up purchasing a couple more Echo devices to have throughout the house to use the "Drop In" skill as an intercom. I am constantly discovering new useful skills that can help me through the day and find myself relying more on the Echo devices and the Alexa app for the smartphone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2018
Data:
A Christmas present - So after less than one month, I'm still finding out what Alexa can do. I hear all the business and political news each day. We ask a lot of silly questions "Alexa, how far is it to the moon? How hot is the sun?" Answers are specific. We listen to some great music selections thru Amazon Prime. I receive the stock market news. I just purchased a "smart plug" so we can turn lights on and off at a command or at set specific times. Alexa will tell jokes of the day - easy, silly ones that kids enjoy. Want the sound louder or softer? - just say Alexa, turn down or up the sound. ALL IS GOOD.
One wish - that the echo had "blue tooth" capability.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2019
Data: I bought this for my elderly father, who just turned 93. He says he's going to live forever and so far, so good. Still, my old man isn't the guy he used to be when he served in the Army during WW2. He doesn't see the numbers on his cordless phone as well as he used to and sometimes he'd like to turn on a light or two without getting up. Now, all he has to do is say, "Alexa, call that damn fool son of mine," and I answer him on my phone or one of my Echos. I even set up his lights from my home and I live he Mass. and he's in Maryland. Five stars from me and I'm hard to please.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2018
Data:
I bought this on prime day and saved lots.

I have 3 large blue tooth speakers in my house that I used for years, the echo plus was louder than all 3 combined at the same time. Very impressed with the clarity and volume.

You will need a paid subscription to some form of steaming audio. That’s just a sad fact. It’ll play pandora and Spotify but it’s limited in skips and song selection without a subscription

Does not stream YouTube music or YouTube audio

Apple users will be disappointed to see that it’s not as convenient as an apple device

Overall, I still loved the device but I’ll be getting the DOT which has an audio out jack (as does the echo plus) and just connect to external speakers

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2018
Data:
At a volume setting of half or less, the speaker sounds like there is something rattling, crackling or vibrating in it. I'd understand if the volume was set higher. All speakers get distorted when over-driven. But this doesn't sound like this is an over-driven case; sounds like more of a rattle/crackle. Possibly because the bass is too high. Learned that there is no ability to adjust any of the sound characteristics (other than volume). I will attempt to exchange it assuming it is just an isolated problem.

UPDATE: Amazon took care of this ASAP. Pretty impressed with the quick care on this. Amazon send me a new unit (I think it arrived the next day). The new unit works great. We love our speaker.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
Data: I love my echo plus. I haven't one bad thing to say. It controller music when I need it too. With a great sounding 360 speaker. I also bought a 4k fire TV and it can open Amazon prime video or Netflix at any moment. The included hue lighting makes this product even better. I found myself with a whole array of smart lights perfect for any house or entertainment room. The addition of phone calls on the mic and speaker makes it practical when your busy in the kitchen or on the computer. Alexa will controll it all as soon as you say "Hey Alexa". And if the always on mic concerns you well you can always mute the device. This is a must buy for anyone interested in ease and comfort.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2017
Data: I saw the dot on sale and was really considering it, so I started reading about it and other Echo products.. when I had heard about having to buy hubs for different brands smart items I felt a bit deterred by the extra expenses involved in starting to have a smart home.. when I read about the Plus I was super excited it had it's own hub, was on sale, and came with a free bulb.. couldn't resist.. can't wait to get the 4 pack of Phillips bulbs I just ordered and I'm super excited for my LED strip lights I ordered to get here too! Plus Already trying to decide what item is next.. even ordered the new Kindle .. hub or not this fun echo plus and smart home are getting my dollars .. hahahaha

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2018
Data: I have only had my echo plus for three weeks. I have four Phillips Hue bulbs and a Nest Thermostat linked. The linking process is about as easy as it can be. I have the ability to control each bulb individually or in groups. There is a learning curve with dimming the lights. Alexa works off of a 1 through 10 scale for light brightness and speaker volume. This is something I did not read in any of the information I had prior to getting the echo plus or with the paperwork that came with it. It would be a good idea for the manufacturer to provide that information. Once you discover how to adjust levels, the system works really well.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
Data: On my nightstand, use it all the time

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
Data: I use my Alexa every day!!!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2018
Data:
The Echo has been fantastic. I haven’t even begun to explore the things it is capable of, and I’ve used and looked through many of the apps. The built in speaker is excellent for its size, and as a built in auxiliary port.

The apps and games are fantastic. There’s everything from trivia and funny apps to role-playing games that test you in a completely different way. The available apps and games are plentiful, and they are steadily growing from a variety of developers.

Also, this can be connected to a variety of other devices or things in your home if you wish to do so. I honestly can say I wish I had more time to explore the capabilities of the Amazon Echo Plus!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
Data: We went to a Best Buy with the intention of buying Alexa products, instead were talked into the Google Home products. Bought the Google Home and the Home Mini... has trouble from the start setting them up, and they couldn’t understand my husband (Scottish accent). After days of the “oops, something went wrong” command.. we returned them and bought the Amazon Echo Show and the Echo Plus... so easy to set up! It connected immediately to my amazon account and was way easier to navigate. They both understand commands from my husband on the first try and have yet to give an error message. We have loved these two products and should have gone with what we intended in the first place! You won’t regret your purchase!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
Data: I bought this about a year ago. I don't use it for listening to music. I actually bought it to turn my house into a smart home. i.e. (Control lights, alarm system, Nest Thermostat etc) So instead of using the voice command I mostly have used the app on my cell. So far all the devices that I connected to it, have worked great. I never had to use any of the light switches in my house or even physically go to the AC thermostat. Its all controlled from my app on my I-phone. The few times I have use the Echo for music the voice command works great and the sound is awesome.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2018
Data: This is an amazing device. We purchased the Echo Dot to try out the "Alexa" possibilities and were sold. A few days later we went back and got the Echo Plus. This is stationed in our living room and is great. Since it includes a hub, we bought some of the Philips Hue lights and control turning them on and off, and brightness just by asking Alexa. We placed the dot in the bedroom and bought another for our office. Alexa responds to nearly every question: what is the weather forecast for any city? what's the population of Berlin? where is the closest Starbucks? Dim living room lights? Play Proud Mary by Creedence Clearwater! Play Christmas music! etc., etc., etc.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2018
Data: So far this echo plus has been fantastic. It came with a single Phillips hue bulb, which is my only "smart" home device. I have given five stars based almost entirely on the fact that, bottom line, it's a great speaker to my ears. I've spent the same amount on speakers that didn't perform as well as the echo plus, and you can talk to it. There's something nice about telling Alexa to play one of your favorite bands, and poof, their playing. Overall, would definitely recommend. Also, should mention that I chose this model because of the built in smart hub. However, I haven't had that much of an opportunity to play around with that aspect. Will update if anything major changes in the future!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018
Data:
This is too awesome, Connects with my Echo Dot and works with my Phillips Hue light bulbs. No more searching for light switches in the dark..Nice
And all the skills you can enable on this is wonderful. Play music, Sleep sounds and ask Alexia questions it even has 20 Questions game. Totally fun and interesting and informative. I seen all the youtube videos about not asking Alexa Questions at 3am because she becomes wicked. Not sure about that as I've not had a chance to try it out. There's a lot she don't know but she is learning daily. Possibilities are endless. I highly recommend this product. It also works with home security though I don't have that going on right now.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
Data: This was a Christmas gift from my son and daughter-in-law. BEST GIFT EVER! My favorite thing is that I can ask Alexa to play a song any time I want to, and it sounds amazing! I love getting the emails with great examples of questions to ask, so we are learning much more as time goes by! The only time I am remotely disappointed is when I ask for a particular song and Alexa does not know the song! I know that there is so much more to learn and I do not yet know how to use some of the features. When I have a question about products or compatible services, I do not like that I cannot reach someone to speak to.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
Data:

For music and news, the fidelity is good. This hits better base than the echo 2 pucks.

The Echo plus pairs with Zigbee devices very well. I was able to connect several lights quickly. I want to connect sensors but haven't figured that out yet.

Overall, I am satisfied with the Echo Plus

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2018
Data: Alexa is a great addition to my life. I thought these devises were ridiculous until I spent two weeks with Alexa on vacation. I bought one as soon as I returned. She is worth her weight just for the music. Wake up, tell her to play Beck. Come home from work, tell her to play L7. Late night chill, tell her to play Morcheeba. Whatever it is you like. There is always music playing in my place now. Turn it up, turn it down, pause. So much better than fumbling with my phone or putting on a record. (most times) The light bulb is great, too. On, off, dim. I use that all the time. I'm just scratching the surface of her and I love it already.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2018
Data: been using the echo plus with hub for a few weeks now and dont have any complaints, does exactly as describe, actually even better than expected. the mic this thing has to pick up your voice is very good, better than some google home systems ive seen. even with the music blasting, i can just say "Alexa" in a normal tone without shouting even from across the room and Alexa will pick it up. Speakers are very loud and clear, the sub on this thing is decent for the size and price we are paying. I cant speak on how the actual hub works though, i have not purchase any other smart home devices to try it out yet, but great so far on everything else.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
Data: I own several Echo devices including the Echo Show 1st gen, the Echo dot, and Echo spot. I love the sound quality of the Plus and have loved the Hub functionality with several smart devices throughout the house. This has a solid build and looks nice. Mic has respectable sensitivity. Have not had a chance to compare to the next gen Echo Plus, but I intentionally bought the older model because of what I read about the sound quality compared to the second gen. Probably not a difference most people would really notice, but I didn't see any compelling reason to spend more for the newer one.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2018
Data: Love...Love...Love the Echo Plus :) The sound surprised me. It sounds great. I know some was complaining about the sound, but it's not going to give you the thumping/booming bass that you hear from a lot from cars (which I like too). lol! I do recommend this because it has made our life so much easier. Now when my wife comes home late in morning from work, she doesn't have to worry about stumbling and falling now (yes it happened...that's why we got this). She now tells Alexa to turn on the lights. I can't say enough good things about it... We've had it for 8 months now and it works great! This was a gift that my wife appreciated. Get it :)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
Data: The sound quality is simply outstanding for such a small footprint. Besides all the great "Alexa" capabilities, I often use the echo to play music from my laptop or mobile phone. We ask Alexa questions all the time, such as "how far is it from Baton Rouge to Houston", or "where is Gonzaga University?". It is also a super convenient timer/alarm/reminder, such as "remind me to take my pills at 6 o'clock", or "wake me to music at 6:15". It's also nice to get a quick news recap in the morning from various source that you can choose.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2018
Data: I had the first gen when the Echo first came out. Back when it was for Prime members only. I can't really tell the sound difference on this one. Sounds pretty much the same for me. But I use it more for it's smart features over playing music. That is what I have my sound system for. I do love the new white color. It's very clean and polished looking. The first unit I had wouldn't connect to wifi and after some back and forth with the app and reset I hit up returns. They sent me a new unit ASAP and that one connected just fine and works like a dream. I purchased some HUE color bulbs and it works great for them.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018
Data:
My primary use for this is to enhance/replace my aging X-10 home automation. The Echo Plus does that and a while lot more. I bought 2 of Sylvania''s Osram color bulbs and in having a blast with them. I probably won't buy more because of the expense but I absolutely love turning them red and dimming them to 20% to simulate the night lighting on a Navy ship.

Back to the Echo Plus ... setup was simple. Adding accessories is simple (although there is a short learning curve) and I couldn't be happier. Amazon's recent purchase of Ring doorbell systems should add even more uses for this product in the address of home automation. I can't wait!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
Data: This is the 3rd unit I purchased all the way from gen 1 to the plus. The only reason I purchased this is because it works so well and I wanted it in other rooms as well. All my switches work great and I have had not issues. I the past, I did have some ghost commands when Alexa would answer a question when no one asked her to but I think some recent ipdates May have resolved this. It just keeps improving over time, not with call capabilities. I work with adapting smart homes and this is by far the cheapest, best way so far. Can’t wait to see what they come up with next.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2018
Data: I got this mostly for my wife as we are both somewhat handicapped and the prospect of controlling lights. I was mildly surprisedas to the ease of setting it up. Was less than 5 minutes till it said HELLO. after a few days and a chance to start hooking up the switches she was so happy and I was getting hooked to. She asks it questions all the time. Says good morning and night to it, and it answers too. There are times it misses what we say, but mostly it is really good. I am very happy with it, And Now have 2 dots to keep it company.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2018
Data: Before buying this I had previous experience using a 2nd gen echo dot I bought for my grandparents which I found to be very cool. More recently I had experience using a google home mini I got from Verizon with my new phone, and ended up hating it. When I noticed the echo plus had a built in smart hub I was all for it. Now I use it practically every day without fail and love the convenience of voice commands with smart lights and controlling my dish receiver. The sound quality is pretty great as well. I can turn the volume up to 7 and listen to music from another room no problem. Highly recommended!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2018
Data: I just got my Echo Plus today, and I have to say the sound is remarkable. I have been listening to my Spotify playlist all day and the sound quality is amazing. It really shows up in all the different songs. I’m very happy with it. Alexa takes a little getting used to. Just getting used to the different ways to ask her things, and how to be more specific. It’s going to be a lot o fun for our family. The most difficult thing about this whole Alexa thing is getting my 6 year old son to stop asking her to fart. Hopefully your children don’t get wind of some of the things you can ask her!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018
Data: I was a little apprehensive about buying this because I saw reviews saying it sounds like crap. I'm no audiophile by any means so maybe it's that, but I think it sounds great considering the size. It fills my living room with sound and gets pretty loud while remaining clear. I haven't had any issues pairing with my devices or utilizing any of the voice commands. I have it paired to an EcoBee3, my Firestick, and a Phillip's Hue light bulb. I plan on adding devices as I go. I love this thing and I'm glad I scooped it up! I have only had it around 2 weeks. Will update if I run into issues.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2018
Data:
So far the Echo Plus is an awesome addition to my home. The skills (apps) you can enable make Alexa extremely useful for a variety of things that include but are not limited to: Smart home control (lights, light switches, power outlets, locks, etc), reminders, making appointments, shopping lists, voice messaging friends with an Echo, making calls, playing games, finding movies, finding my phone, help with cooking, help with pets, the news, my commute to work, jokes, meditation, music, setting an ambient atmosphere with lights and music, etc, etc, etc.
The list goes on and Alexa's skills are growing, plus you can use the Alexa Blueprints app to create your own skills/apps for your personal use.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
Data:
So far, I really like it. It took maybe 10 minutes to get it on my network and working after un-boxing it. I think as soon as I powered it on, Amazon pushed the Alexa app to my kindle for configuration. I also downloaded the app to my phone from the Google play store.

It came with a Hue bulb. Alexa recognized it and added to the Smart Home devices right out of the box. I've also added the TP Link smart plug, and I'll be adding additional devices soon.

I purchased the Plus specifically to begin dipping my toes in the smart home waters, and so far it has been fairly easy and painless.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2018

They sent us an Alexa controlled lightbulb that's fun too. I have it hooked up to my Google Calendar and can check my schedule and even add events right to my Google Calendar via Alexa.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2017
Data:
We purchased our first Echo in November of 2014, 3 years ago this month. She was the hit of our Thanksgiving dinner celebration that year but could do only a fraction of what she is capable of today. We added smart bulbs like the Philips Hue white and colored bulbs, GE Link and TP Link bulbs, smart plugs, smart wall switches, and smart device timers. We added them over the years as they became available on Amazon. (And on sale!) We had to purchase hubs to run the Philips and GE bulbs when we first started adding bulbs. The 1st Gen Philips hub worked well for about a year and then started having problems with disconnecting from the network and not playing nice with Alexa. Philips finally replaced it under warranty. The Wink hub which controlled the GE bulbs has always worked flawlessly. But whenever we changed our network password, we had to go around and reset all the bulbs, often having to re-register some of them and then go into the Alexa app and have her rediscover them. Perhaps not a big deal when you’re only using a couple bulbs, but a real time waster when almost every bulb in a large 2 story house is a smart bulb.

This Echo Plus allowed me to disconnect the hubs and control everything with Alexa alone. She didn’t discover the bulbs right away. I had to go in and deregister them from their hubs and then rediscover them and add them to the Plus. But now they work flawlessly. Let me tell you how I did that. In your Alexa app, click on the little menu thingie in the upper left hand corner which will open a drop down menu. Select Smart Home from the menu. You’ll see a page showing devices, groups and scenes. Click on the little ? In the upper right hand corner. This will open a page with instructions and clickable commands for deregistering a list of different devices from their hubs and having Alexa discover and connect them to the Echo Plus. It’s a little bit of a pain to have to go around and get serial numbers off the bulbs or turn others on and off, but you only have to do it once, then Alexa has them. And it isn’t difficult. No more running upstairs to push the button on the Philips hub to get bulbs to respond. No more extra hubs sitting around consuming electricity. And no more dealing with the clunky Philips Hue app (If you don’t believe me, go read the reviews for that app.)

Now that everything is connected through Alexa, I have set up Routines to turn a few of our lights on and off and specified times. (Voice commands can still be used to override a routine and they don’t interfere with your routine the next time it is scheduled.) I can also turn them on and off remotely from the Alexa app. I have a routine set for our kitchen Alexa so that when I say, “Alexa, good morning” she will turn on one of the kitchen smart bulbs at 50% brightness and the other at 100% brightness and read me the local weather report. Our bedroom Alexa has a routine that is triggered when I say “Alexa, start my day”. She turns on one of the lights at 20% and reads my morning news flash. How cool is that? Here’s how you set up a routine:

1. Go to the menu and select "Routines."
2. Select the + icon.

From here, you can specify when Alexa will do something, and what it will do.
-- Select "When this happens" to pick a scheduled time for the Routine to run, or enter a word or phrase that will activate it.
-- Select "Add action" to select what the Routine will run. You can add multiple actions, one at a time.
-- Once you have selected a “cue” and an action, select the device you want the Routine to play on.
-- Select "Create" to save the routine.

Groups are also a great feature. You can Group your Echo and Dot device’s together in a group, give the group a name, and then tell Alexa, “Play my <Bruno Mars> playlist on my <downstairs> group. She instantly starts to play it on all the devices in the group. You could also play a single song or a radio station like iHeart or Pandora. We have a large family room/kitchen combo with the Plus on a desk about midway in the room and a Dot connected by 3.5mm Cable to a Heos speaker, with excellent sound. We put the two in a group. The sound is amazing! It’s better than stereo, especially with the new Plus. The Plus is slightly stronger on the treble than the 1st Gen Echo. The Heos is strong on bass. They sync perfectly with each other and never miss a beat. BTW, I rarely used the Heos except for parties before we got the Dot because I was so spoiled by controlling music by voice on our Echo. It was much better than using an app to control the Heos. Now the Heos is used all the time since I can use it with Alexa. Grouping with the Plus makes it that much better. We can also add Echos in other rooms to the group, which we do when we have people over. We can now have the same music playing in the living room/dining room as in the family room. They are easily added-or subtracted in the Alexa app.

Like the regular Echo, this Plus can control all of our white bulbs and the the Hue color bulb by voice, including changing the colors to any color I can think of (pink, teal, red, blue, purple, aqua, etc.) dimming to any percentage and on/off and adding them to routines or group. For example, I can say, “Turn on the downstairs lights” and Alexa will turn on every light I’ve added to that group. The Plus controls our smart plugs and switches just like the regular Echo did and we add those to groups as well. Bulbs, switches and plugs can be a part of several different groups. (The group Holiday lights turned on all the LED lighted pumpkins and orange lights on our banisters when we said, “Alexa, turn on the holiday lights.”

We can also use this Plus like the other Echos, to Drop In on our other rooms. Since we have Echos in just about every room we now have a home intercom system that works beautifully.

We’ve watched Alexa get smarter and smarter almost weekly, from that first day with her 3 years ago. I have no doubt that she will continue learn new skills to make our lives even easier and more fun. (Did I mention that she can switch our older LG TV to PlayStation Vue streaming through our Amazon Fire TV device and start and pause shows by voice through either the Echos or Fire TV remote? Yeah, we dumped our satellite TV provider and now pay less than half with live and recorded streaming. But that’s for another review!)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2018
Data:
The Echo Plus Gen 1 is a great addition to my smart home. It gives me all my original Echo provides plus lets me eliminate my Philips Hue hub and works with all my other Z-wave devices. The Gen-1 form factor is almost identical to the original Echo but with a faster processor and integrated hub. Nice!

I love my Echo/Alexa. Voice control of my smart home and other Amazon devices plus response to information requests (what's new, etc.) and nearly endless entertainment options have made this an integral part of my home life. As an early adopter of the original gen-1 Echo I have been very impressed by how Amazon continues to improve existing operation, add new features and new capabilities.

I got my first Echo in March 2015. Since then I've seen a lot of new capabilities added:
+ A constant integration of more services like Pandora, traffic and Amazon Radio stations
+ Connected home control now with the integrated Z-Wave device hub and control of WiFI smart home devices like those from Belkin and TP-Link.
+ integration with IFTTT (if this then that) service for triggers and actions
+ integration popular services like Google Calendar and much more
+ integrated Amazon purchase/ordering

The list keeps growing. It's part of the beauty of a product that's mostly in the Amazon cloud. New features and capabilities are not dependent solely upon the computing and storage of the Echo device itself.

The Echo is also a very nice bluetooth speaker. It pairs readily with multiple devices - phone, computer and even my Amazon Fire TV so it can provide an enhanced audio experience. With some devices control of tracks can controlled by voice like skip or repeat, etc.

Another essential part of the Echo is the FREE Amazon Echo App . I have it installed on my Kindle Fire HD 8.9in and on my iPhone 6. This provides simple setup and configuration of services and integration with supported connected home devices. It also provides the mobile part of the todo and shopping lists.

The Echo has been a game changer for my home experience. This Echo Plus even more so. It's the closest thing I've used to a computer you can just speak to and be understood - like on the old Star Trek series. I wonder how I lived without it!

I gotta give the Echo Plus 5 stars. Not just for how good it is but in anticipation of all the new things that will surely will come along soon.
